[b][color=white]Defunction of Inactive Accounts[/color][/b]
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] has closed all the accounts that are not logged into for a year. The precise number of closed accounts include [b]550 Ub3r[/b], [b]2500 L33t[/b] and [b]25,000 Regular Members[/b]. The reason behind this is to refrain users from selling their accounts and evade future scams. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5515173] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Trust Scan Update[/color][/b]
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url] has added a new field in the Trust Scan page i.e., "CLOSED REASON". By this members will get to know the reason behind account termination. Currently, the following are the reasons that are rolled out: [b]Trolling, Multiple Accounts, Ban Evasion, Low Quality Posting, Inactivity, Lost or Stolen, Reputation Abuse[/b] and [b]Deal Disputes[/b]. [i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5515173] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=left][size=x-small][color=white][b]*[/b][/color]As of the Tuesday prior to release.[/size][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/NotableThreads/Tsundere.png[/img][/align]

[list][b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5515173][b]Inactive Accounts Closed And Trust Scan[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][b][color=#FF66FF]Omniscient[/color][/b][/url]
Omniscient has recently closed over 25,000+ inactive members on the forum. In addition to closing all these inactive accounts, Omni has added a new parameter to the trust scan feature which shows the reason why someone was closed. Omni stated, "Current reasons that you'll see are; Trolling, Multiple Accounts, Ban Evasion, Low Quality Posting, and Inactivity."

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5513363][b]Global Ignore List[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2604753][b][color=#00AAFF]The J0ker[/color][/b][/url]
A new feature has been added to the 3P1C usergroup. Members with an 3P1C membership now have the option to do a "Universal Profile Ignore". Read more about it and what features the "Universal Profile Ignore" has in this thread.

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5515361][b][Official HF Award] Graphic of the Month - Explained[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3077324][b][color=#00AAFF]Mαxim[/color][/b][/url]
The "Graphic of the Month" contest has returned with the help of [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][color=#EFEFEF][b]iHydra[/b][/color][/url], [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3077324][color=#00AAFF][b]Mαxim[/b][/color][/url], and [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=502172][color=#EFEFEF][b]Novica[/b][/color][/url]. This contest will be different than the Member of the Month, as there will be judges rather than the vote from the community.

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5514418][b]Member of the Month - Explained[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1610871][b][color=#EFEFEF]Rʏᴀɴ Rᴇʏɴᴏʟᴅs ❤️[/color][/b][/url]
We were just speaking about the Member of the Month! Well, it has finally been revived after former Mentor, Froggy stepped down from running it. A new thread was made explaining how the contest goes.[/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5513445][b]Beginner Guide To Selling On HF [Threads, Stickies, Ads, Sales Tags & More Explained][/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1033713][b][color=#EFEFEF]Formula1[/color][/b][/url]
Back again with another helpful thread, Forumla1 has created a beginners guide to get you started in the Hack Forums' Marketplace. Things from advertising all the way to gaining for status and reputation on the forum. This is a must see guide!

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5513070][b]| Illuminati Innuendo | Emotional Support Desk.[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3280351][b][color=#EFEFEF]Βane[/color][/b][/url]
The official group of Hack Forums, Illuminati, have created an Innuendo support desk. If you need to get something off your chest or need some advice, come post here.

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5502682][b]| Dawn Innuendo | LGBT Supportive Q&A / Help Desk[/b][/url] - [url=Nevieth][b][color=#EFEFEF]Nevieth[/color][/b][/url]
A nice, friendly LGBT supportive Help Desk by the members of the Dawn usergroup. 

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5514667][b]PGP: Pretty Good Privacy | Illustrated & Explained For Newbs! [ TUTORIAL ][/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1774338][b][color=#00AAFF]Canonsx130[/color][/b][/url]
The member Canons has created a pretty friendly tutorial on explaining what Pretty Good Privacy, or PGP for short is. A good read for those interested in the topic.

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5513818][b][TUT] How to Crack Programs For Beginners with IDA Pro[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3108023][b][color=#EFEFEF]Zer0Memo0ry[/color][/b][/url]
In this tutorial users will learn how to crack programs using IDA Pro. This tutorial includes helpful pictures which may assist users even more who would like to learn how to crack programs.

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5513376][b][Metasploit] How to create and use a Reverse TCP Shell [Noob Friendly][/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3294208][b][color=#EFEFEF]ｋａ＄ｈ[/color][/b][/url]
Using the program Metasploit, the user ｋａ＄ｈ will assist you on how to create a Reverse TCP Shell. A nice and basic guide for those just beginning at hacking.

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5516966][b]Linear search in different collections, Practical runtime analysis[The Society][/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2206343][b][color=#EFEFEF]Mefie[/color][/b][/url]
As stated in the guide, "I am showing the pseudo-code of linear search in unsorted array, sorted array and linked list." Something to look into in terms of the business side of things.
[/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5516525][b]Favorite Type of Dog?[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2359475][b][color=#EFEFEF]oRequiem[/color][/b][/url]
What is your favorite dog breed? Let others know which are your favorites.

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5517169][b]Got some new ink today[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=7807][b][color=#00AAFF]VipVince[/color][/b][/url]
Check out the new ink that Vince has recently gotten. That looks painful to get!

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5517264][b]Any other street racers?[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1298336][b][color=#00AAFF]Lil Dicky[/color][/b][/url]
Lil Dicky is curious to know if there are other street racers on the forum. What car do you drive, too?
[/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5516230][b]Night Fury's Three-Year Feedback[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2110841][b][color=white]Night Fury[/color][/b][/url]
Fellow Hack Forums News Team writer, Night Fury, has posted a feedback after being a member of the forums for three years now. What is even crazier is that he finished typing it up while on vacation in Hawaii! Wow!

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5515795][b]Computer Professor's Feedback | 13,000+ Posts | 5+ Years | 1000+ Rep[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=874137][b][color=00AAFF]Computer Professor[/color][/b][/url]
Computer Professor has achieved many different things on this forum such as gaining over 1,000 rep, all the way to more than 13,000 posts. Truly an outstanding accomplishment. Congrats on five years, Professor![/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5511552][b]Free Domain Contest [.com/.net/.eu/.pw] - 25 prizes - EVERYONE[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=505114][b][color=#00AAFF]Kasgal[/color][/b][/url]
This is your chance to win a domain  curtousiy of Kasgel. Ever wanted to get a cool name, but did not have the funds to snag it? Now is your chance to get it!

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5516168][b]$5 BTC Giveaway - EVERY SINGLE DAY (All Users) - No Strings Attached[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2663735][b][color=#99FF00]FastBets[/color][/b][/url]
Everyday you can earn a chance to win some BTC. Just follow the instructions in the thread!

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5513899][b][Wrecked] $75 BTC Giveaway - ENTER NOW[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1025222][b][color=#00AAFF]Wre©ked[/color][/b][/url]
Enter this awesome giveaway in order to have the chance of winning $75 BTC![/list][/list]

[list][b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b]
[list]

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5514488][b]Good tv shows[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2946011][b][color=#99FF00]xxDr3aMz[/color][/b][/url]
Come and recommend some good TV shows to xxDr3aMz. Maybe you'll find a show that interests you too.

[url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5514498][b]Emotional Raps[/b][/url] - [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=620668][b][color=white]Renowned[/color][/b][/url]
Think you have some emotional rap songs Renowned would like? Come post 'em here.[/list][/list]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Interview/321a.gif[/img][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Interview/325.png[/img][/align]

[align=center][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview [/font][/size][/color][color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702]Stashy[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Welcome to the HF News Interview Edition #325 Stashy, thanks for taking the time to let me interview you. Before we start, as always, are there any shout outs you'd like to make?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702][color=white][b]Stashy:[/b][/color][/url] No. I don't have HF friends sadly.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] So what are your plans now that the new year just began? Any resolutions?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702][color=white][b]Stashy:[/b][/color][/url] 1) Stop smoking
2) Stop buying so many phones & clothes

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Are you smoking the herbal varieties or cancer sticks?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702][color=white][b]Stashy:[/b][/color][/url] herbal varieties

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Why would you want to stop smoking god's gift?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702][color=white][b]Stashy:[/b][/url] Because, when I do I get really lazy and cannot get any work done. Which makes me unhappy.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity[/b][/color][/url] You still find the time to watch plenty of hentai. Everyone wants to know, what's your favorite animoo?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702[color=white][b]Stashy:[/b][/color][/url] Lol, I don't watch anime. But my favorite annigay would have to be Zero no Tsukaima. Sadly, I don't have time to watch anime anymore. :(

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] AYou must be a busy man if you don't have time for the animoos anymore damn. What's Zero No Tsukaima about? Sounds like a weeaboo earthquake.
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702][color=white][b]Stashy:[/b][/url] It's about a tiny girl fighting with a guy with no magic in mostly all episodes but she's very cute. I'd give her a 10/10 but she has no tits + she's annoying.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Exactly what I meant. All anime = hentai. Now that the group is getting sold soon are you planning on staying active on HF?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702][color=white][b]Stashy:[/b][/color][/url] I don't know to be honest. It's been a real train wreck for me. After I got rep killed I stopped caring about my rep and posting etiquette. But I still have to be HQ because I am in writers afterall. I'll try to be active but not as much as I used to.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Same here, after I sell the group I'll likely not be as active as usual and need to take a break from HF. It's healthy once in awhile to take a lengthy vacation ban, I did for a couple months last summer. But good luck on the rep rebuild. Are you on the wiki team or news team?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702][color=white][b]Stashy:[/b][/color][/url] Wiki team, might be active there and possibly move into the news team. But that's if I decide to be more active. But as you said, I might also take a lengthy vacation ban. It all depends on my mood within the next couple of weeks.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1327245][color=magenta][b]zSerity:[/b][/color][/url] Sounds like a good plan. Good luck getting active and also good luck quitting smoking if that's what you want to do. I've thought about it before too. This also brings us to 9 questions, before we end it is there anything you'd like to leave the reader's with? Maybe an inspirational quote from Stashy himself?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702[color=white][b]Stashy:[/b][/color][/url] You're throwing me on the spot like I am a prophet or something. But I guess, if you put your mind to it and don't let the gambling scripts get you down. You can do anything you want on the internet. From making money wise and to make new friends. Not really a quote or anything inspiring but I tried.

[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[b][color=white]Back to School![/color][/b]
For those who are heading back to school, study hard!

[color=transparent]    [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/5EHiJAb.png[/img][/align]

[align=left]
[color=white][url=http://www.razerzone.com/project-valerie][b]Razer's Triple Monitor Gaming Laptop Concept: Project Valerie[/b][/url][/color]
What more could a gamer want than a 4K display on their laptop? How about packing three of them into one machine. Razer's ambitious new Project Valerie concept offers just that, cramming two fold-out displays into a laptop chassis that lets you get an immersive multi-monitor experience wherever you go. Razer described Project Valerie as the “first automated triple-display laptop.” It features three 17.3-inch 4K displays and a built-in mechanical keyboard. As soon as the laptop opens, two monitors slide out of the sides of the main one and adjust automatically in place. Although this is just a concept, it is a very interesting concept, and if properly executed it could be a very exciting machine. For the time being, it is being shown at CES as a working prototype, which means it is possible it may be put into production.

[color=white][url=http://www.forbes.com/sites/kathleenchaykowski/2017/01/05/former-snapchat-employee-alleges-company-inflated-growth-metrics/#6236215c54dd][b]Snapchat Ex-Employee Sues Company Over False Growth Numbers[/b][/url][/color]
Anthony Pompliano, a former Snapchat employee, has filed a lawsuit that alleging the company lied to him about Snapchat’s growth metrics while recruiting him for its business operations team in August 2015 from Facebook. Pompliano worked in Snapchat’s business operations department for three weeks before his firing in September 2015. He stated in court papers Wednesday that the company has lied about the reason for his termination since then, hindering his ability to land another job in the social media industry. "Mr. Pompliano was terminated because he refused to participate in a scheme to deceive the public and artificially inflate Snapchat's valuation in anticipation of its” initial public stock offering, the lawsuit states.

[color=white][url=http://www.usatoday.com/story/tech/news/2017/01/04/ces-2017-acer-launching-9000-laptop/96147922/][b]Acer's Predator 21 X to Become First Gaming Laptop to Offer Curved Display[/b][/url][/color]
Acer has launched another mind-blowing gaming computer at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES 2017) in Las Vegas. With a whopping price tag of $8999, Acer's monstrous Predator 21 X will become the first ever gaming laptop to offer a curved display. This beast of a machine features a curved 21-inch display that offers a resolution of 2560×1080 pixels with 120Hz refresh rate, as well as G-Sync support to eliminate visual artifacts and issues like screen tearing. The Predator 21 X is quite the literal heavyweight as well, weighing in at 19.4 pounds. The device runs on an 7th-generation Intel Core i7-7820HK Kaby Lake processor and comes paired with two GeForce GTX 1080 graphics processors in SLI configuration.
[/align]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/HackingNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Kaspersky Users Vulnerable to Attacks[/color][/b]
Travis Ormandy, a Google Security Engineer, has discovered a Kaspersky vulnerability. The issue lies when it intercepts HTTPS traffic to scan for online threats. Kaspersky Lab updated the program to fix the issue that exposed users to interception attacks when browsing the web. Unfortunately, with many websites using HTTPS, it's not possible to simply scan the web traffic coming to the browser. As of December 28th, the problems in the software were fixed.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.ehackingnews.com/2017/01/kaspersky-av-users-exposed-to-attacks.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]FBI Hacked and Over 50 Agents' Details Posted[/color][/b]
Recent evidence shows that the FBI has been hacked. A hacker with the Twitter handle CyberZeist has claimed to have hacked the FBI's website and leaked personal account information to the public of numerous FBI agents. CyberZeist shared the loophole to the FBI on December 22nd, but gave them time to fix the issue before releasing details publicly. The hacker used a zero-day in the Plone CMS that the FBI uses to host its websites. There were also several photos tweeted off the hacking process.[i][size=x-small][url=http://www.hackersnewsbulletin.com/2017/01/fbi-hacked.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]27,000+ MongoDB Databases Held by Ransomware in a Week[/color][/b]
Ransomware attacks on insecure MongoDB installations have doubled in theperiod of a day. On Monday, researcher Victor Gevers found almost 200 installations of MongoDB that were erased and held for ransom. The attackers ask victims to pay a hefty fee to restore their data. Recent numbers compiled by Merrigan estimate the number of compromised systems to be 27,000. Initial ransoms started at 0.2 BTC, but recently they have reached up to 1 BTC.[i][size=x-small][url=http://thehackernews.com/2017/01/mongodb-database-security.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]
